final_answer:
The humor and satire in this image stem from the juxtaposition of a carefree adult lifestyle with the unexpected consequence of reincarnation as a crying baby. 

In the left panel, a person wearing a shirt with "YOU ONLY LIVE ONCE" is unconscious at a bar, implying an indulgent or reckless lifestyle. The phrase "You only live once" suggests a philosophy of living life to the fullest without regard for consequences.

The right panel, divided into two parts, humorously suggests that as the person's spirit leaves their body, it enters a crying baby. This twist plays on the idea of reincarnation, poking fun at the notion that the consequence of such a lifestyle might be starting over as a baby, rather than just living once.

The clever use of visuals and text creates a satirical commentary on the "YOLO" mindset by whimsically suggesting that life might not be as singular as the phrase implies, adding a humorous twist to the idea of living without limits.
